CatDescriptText: Mr. John Bolden, Earle Hotel, Seventh and Liberty Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 14, 1958, pg. 8 with question: "Do you think ministers should invest in business enterprises for profit, or become executives or directors of such concern?" answer reads: "No, because if he takes care of his ecclesiastical duties, he will not have time to devote to anything else. In other words, if I spend six months taking care of my own business and six months leaving others business along, I will have no time for anything else.  This is the same way that i feel about the question."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John Bolden, wearing hat with dark stripe, two toned polka dot shirt with pens in left breast pocket, zippered jacket, and striped pants with dark belt, standing in front of block building, street with car and building with address 800 on left, hat display in store window on right
